intro: Schmidelia dregeana, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Schmidelia dregeana is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
